CreditPerfRetailLoanToValueRatio.label: Credit Perf Retail Loan To Value Ratio
CreditPerfRetailLoanToValueRatio.description: In the case of a purchase mortgage loan, the ratio obtained by dividing the original mortgage loan amount on the note date by the lesser of the mortgaged property appraised value on the note date or its purchase price. In the case of a refinance mortgage loan, the ratio obtained by dividing the original mortgage loan amount on the note date and the mortgaged property appraised value on the note date. In the case of a seasoned mortgage loan, if the Seller cannot warrant that the value of the mortgaged property has not declined since the note date, Freddie Mac requires that the Seller must provide a new appraisal value, which is used in the LTV calculation. Percentages below 6% or greater than 105% will be disclosed as 'Unknown,' indicated by a blank space. In the case of an FHA/VA mortgage loan, percentages less than 6% or greater than 110% will be disclosed as 'Unknown,' which will be indicated by a blank space.
CreditPerfRetailLoanToValueRatio.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

EnergyUnavailComparison.label: Energy Unavail Comparison
EnergyUnavailComparison.description: Unavailability is a metric that quantifies the amount of energy lost when the system is not operating. This metric compares measured versus expected energy unavailability. This concepts reports the difference which is calculated as Measured – Expected.
EnergyUnavailComparison.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
EnergyUnavailComparison.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

EnergyUnavailExcludExtOrOtherOutagesComp.label: Energy Unavail Exclud Ext Or Other Outages Comparison
EnergyUnavailExcludExtOrOtherOutagesComp.description: Unavailability is a metric that quantifies the amount of energy lost when the system is not operating. This metric compares measured versus expected energy unavailability excluding times external or other outages. This concepts reports the difference which is calculated as Measured – Expected.
EnergyUnavailExcludExtOrOtherOutagesComp.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
EnergyUnavailExcludExtOrOtherOutagesComp.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

EstArrayDegradRate.label: Est Array Degrad Rate
EstArrayDegradRate.description: Estimated percent capacity of the array lost in future periods, e.g., year, month, due to degradation. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
EstArrayDegradRate.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
EstArrayDegradRate.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

EstSystemDegradRate.label: Est System Degrad Rate
EstSystemDegradRate.description: Estimated degradation rate of the system, in percent of kWh lost. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
EstSystemDegradRate.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
EstSystemDegradRate.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

EstimationPeriodForCurtail.label: Estimation Period For Curtail
EstimationPeriodForCurtail.description: Period in which the curtailment amount or percent is estimated, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days, or 'P1Y' represents a reported fact for one year, or 'P1M' represents a reported fact for one month. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis which represents the starting date for the period.
EstimationPeriodForCurtail.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

EstimationPeriodForDegradMeas.label: Estimation Period For Degrad Meas
EstimationPeriodForDegradMeas.description: Period in which the degradation amount or percent is estimated, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days, or 'P1Y' represents a reported fact for one year, or 'P1M' represents a reported fact for one month. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis which represents the starting date for the period.
EstimationPeriodForDegradMeas.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

ExciseAndSalesTaxPerWatt.label: Excise And Sales Tax Per Watt
ExciseAndSalesTaxPerWatt.description: The amount of excise and sales taxes included in sales and revenues, which are then deducted as a cost of sales. Includes excise taxes, which are applied to specific types of transactions or items (such as gasoline or alcohol); and sales, use and value added taxes, which are applied to a broad class of revenue-producing transactions involving a wide range of goods and services.  Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.
ExciseAndSalesTaxPerWatt.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

ExpectEnergyAtArrayDC.label: Expect Energy At Array DC
ExpectEnergyAtArrayDC.description: Expected energy in DC kWh produced at the array. This element should be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of measurement.
ExpectEnergyAtArrayDC.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtArrayDC.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtP50.label: Expect Energy At P50
ExpectEnergyAtP50.description: Expected system production at P50 which is the expected energy production reached with a probability of 50%. This element is used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of production. Usually this will be a year.
ExpectEnergyAtP50.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtP50.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtP75.label: Expect Energy At P75
ExpectEnergyAtP75.description: Expected system production at P75 which is the expected energy production reached with a probability of 75%. This element is used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of production. Usually this will be a year.
ExpectEnergyAtP75.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtP75.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtP90.label: Expect Energy At P90
ExpectEnergyAtP90.description: Expected system production at P90 which is the expected energy production reached with a probability of 90%. This element is used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of production. Usually this will be a year.
ExpectEnergyAtP90.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtP90.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtP95.label: Expect Energy At P95
ExpectEnergyAtP95.description: Expected system production at P95 which is the expected energy production reached with a probability of 95%. This element is used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of production. Usually this will be a year.
ExpectEnergyAtP95.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtP95.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtP99.label: Expect Energy At P99
ExpectEnergyAtP99.description: Expected system production at P99 which is the expected energy production reached with a probability of 99%. This element is used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of production. Usually this will be a year.
ExpectEnergyAtP99.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtP99.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtRevenueMeterInceptToDate.label: Expect Energy At Revenue Meter Incept To Date
ExpectEnergyAtRevenueMeterInceptToDate.description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3. Measured from inception to date.
ExpectEnergyAtRevenueMeterInceptToDate.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtRevenueMeterInceptToDate.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.label: Expect Energy At The Revenue Meter
ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3.  This element is defined as the sum of electrical production over a period of time, for example the first day of the month to the last day of the month, and has a period type of duration. This should not be used with the Period [Axis].
ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod.label: Expect Energy At The Revenue Meter For Period
ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod.description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of measurement and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time. If no Period [Axis] is used, the time period for the value is from the date of the value in the instance document to the end of the life of the system.
ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimes.label: Expect Energy At Unavail Times
ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimes.description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be unavailable when it’s status is observed to be non-functional.This measure reports the amount of energy that is unavailable.
ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimes.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimes.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimesExcludExtOrOth.label: Expect Energy At Unavail Times Exclud Ext Or Other Outages
ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimesExcludExtOrOth.description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be unavailable when it’s status is observed to be non-functional.This measure reports the amount of energy that is unavailable, excluding issues that are outside of the plant's control.
ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimesExcludExtOrOth.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimesExcludExtOrOth.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectEnergyAvailEstRatio.label: Expect Energy Avail Est Ratio
ExpectEnergyAvailEstRatio.description: Expected Energy Availability Estimate is modelled predicted energy for unity availability, and can be calculated by dividing ExpectedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter by Predicted_Energy_Availability. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time.
ExpectEnergyAvailEstRatio.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAvailEstRatio.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

ExpectEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOut.label: Expect Energy Available Exclud Ext Or Other Outages
ExpectEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOut.description: Expected energy available excluding times of external or other outage causes per IEC 61724-3 Section 6.8.1.
ExpectEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOut.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOut.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

ExpectInsolationAtP50.label: Expect Insolation At P50
ExpectInsolationAtP50.description: Expected average P50 insolation generated in kWh per square meter. The value can be reported for the period defined on the PeriodAxis, for example to record the average insolation for Q1, this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis.
ExpectInsolationAtP50.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectInsolationAtP50.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

ExpectInsolationAtP50InceptToDate.label: Expect Insolation At P50 Incept To Date
ExpectInsolationAtP50InceptToDate.description: Expected average P50 insolation generated in kWh per square meters from inception to date.
ExpectInsolationAtP50InceptToDate.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
ExpectInsolationAtP50InceptToDate.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

IrradDiffuseHorizontal.label: Irrad Diffuse Horizontal
IrradDiffuseHorizontal.description: The amount of diffuse radiation received per unit area on a horizontal surface. Diffuse irradiance arrives at the surface of measurement from any direction other than the direction of the sun. Diffuse horizontal irradiance is measured in watts per square meter.
IrradDiffuseHorizontal.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
IrradDiffuseHorizontal.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

IrradDirectNormal.label: Irrad Direct Normal
IrradDirectNormal.description: The amount of direct irradiance received per unit area on a surface that is perpendicular (or normal) to the direction of the sun. Direct irradiance, also termed beam irradiance, is not scattered or reflected by the atmosphere, clouds, or other surfaces before arriving at the surface of measurement. Direct normal irradiance is measured in watts per square meter.
IrradDirectNormal.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
IrradDirectNormal.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

IrradGlobalHorizontal.label: Irrad Global Horizontal

IrradGlobalHorizontal.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

IrradPlaneOfArray.label: Irrad Plane Of Array

IrradPlaneOfArray.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MaxPctThresholdForPmtOfGuarantee.label: Max Pct Threshold For Pmt Of Guarantee
MaxPctThresholdForPmtOfGuarantee.description: Maximum percent loss at which a refund will be paid which effectively puts a cap on the amount of refund. For example, if a guarantee specifies that a refund will be made when output falls between 95-98%, and the output falls to 97%, the refunded amount will be based on 97%. If the loss falls to 94%, the loss will be based on the maximum allowable amount at 95%. 95% is the maximum threshold for payment. Other penalities may apply if the loss falls below the threshold.
MaxPctThresholdForPmtOfGuarantee.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MaxPctThresholdForPmtOfGuarantee.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasCapAtTargetConditions.label: Meas Cap At Target Conditions
MeasCapAtTargetConditions.description: Power measured at the targeted measurement conditions per IEC 61724-2 in kW.
MeasCapAtTargetConditions.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasCapAtTargetConditions.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasClass.label: Meas Class
MeasClass.description: Measurement class per IEC 71724 where Class A is highest and Class C is lowest.
MeasClass.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

MeasEnergy.label: Meas Energy
MeasEnergy.description: Energy measured at the revenue meter for the indicated time period according to IEC 61724-3 Section 6.7.
MeasEnergy.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergy.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyAvailBalanceOfSystemIssues.label: Meas Energy Avail Balance Of System Issues
MeasEnergyAvailBalanceOfSystemIssues.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with Balance of Plant (BOP) components calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to BOP issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.
MeasEnergyAvailBalanceOfSystemIssues.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyAvailBalanceOfSystemIssues.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasEnergyAvailDifference.label: Meas Energy Avail Difference
MeasEnergyAvailDifference.description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be available when it’s status is observed to be functional. Per IECRE 61724-3, this measure can be calculated as simple difference, percent difference, or ratio calculation. This concept should be reported as a Difference, calculated as Measured - Expected.
MeasEnergyAvailDifference.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyAvailDifference.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyAvailPct.label: Meas Energy Avail Pct
MeasEnergyAvailPct.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period calculated from the measured weather data and observed availability which can be obtained by dividing Expected Energy At Revenue Meter by Expected Energy At Unavailable Times. For solar, use IEC 61724-3, Section 6.8.
MeasEnergyAvailPct.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyAvailPct.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasEnergyAvailSingleTurbine.label: Meas Energy Avail Single Turbine
MeasEnergyAvailSingleTurbine.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with the single wind turbine indicated calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to turbine issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.
MeasEnergyAvailSingleTurbine.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyAvailSingleTurbine.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOutag.label: Meas Energy Available Exclud Ext Or Other Outages
MeasEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOutag.description: Actual energy available excluding times of external or other outage causes per IEC 61724-3 Section 6.8.1.
MeasEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOutag.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOutag.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyAvgForPeriod.label: Meas Energy Avg For Period
MeasEnergyAvgForPeriod.description: Computed average energy production for the period defined on the PeriodAxis over all years of operation since activation date in kWh. To record the average energy for Q1 for example this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis. If the period axis is not used this represents the energy over all years of operation since Activation Date (in kWh).
MeasEnergyAvgForPeriod.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyAvgForPeriod.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyLossDueToInverterIssues.label: Meas Energy Loss Due To Inverter Issues
MeasEnergyLossDueToInverterIssues.description: Actual (measured) amount of energy lost due to inverter issues.
MeasEnergyLossDueToInverterIssues.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyLossDueToInverterIssues.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyLossDueToSoiling.label: Meas Energy Loss Due To Soiling
MeasEnergyLossDueToSoiling.description: Actual (measured) amount of energy lost due to soiling.
MeasEnergyLossDueToSoiling.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyLossDueToSoiling.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyToWeatherAdj.label: Meas Energy To Weather Adj
MeasEnergyToWeatherAdj.description: Ratio of measured energy to measured energy adjusted for weather.
MeasEnergyToWeatherAdj.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyToWeatherAdj.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasEnergyWeatherAdj.label: Meas Energy Weather Adj
MeasEnergyWeatherAdj.description: Energy generated over reporting period adjusted for the difference between measured weather conditions, e.g., irradiance and temperature, and expected weather conditions for the same period during the Typical Meteorological Year or the equivalent used to predict P50 energy generation and the expected degradation rate.
MeasEnergyWeatherAdj.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyWeatherAdj.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasEnergyWeatherAdjAvgForPeriod.label: Meas Energy Weather Adj Avg For Period
MeasEnergyWeatherAdjAvgForPeriod.description: Computed average energy generated for the period, adjusted for the difference between measured weather conditions, e.g., irradiance and temperature, and expected weather conditions for the same period during the Typical Meteorological Year or the equivalent used to predict P50 energy generation and the expected degradation rate. The period is defined on the PeriodAxis over all years of operation since activation date in kWh. To record the average energy for Q1 for example this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis. If the period axis is not used this represents the energy over all years of operation since Activation Date (in kWh).
MeasEnergyWeatherAdjAvgForPeriod.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasEnergyWeatherAdjAvgForPeriod.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MeasInsolation.label: Meas Insolation
MeasInsolation.description: Actual measured insolation generated in kWh per square meter for a specific duration of time. This is used to measure the insolation from one date to another date. This differs from the element SystemPerformanceMeasuredInsolationAverage which is used to measure system performance from activation date to the current date and can be reported by dividing by periods such as months and quarters or years.
MeasInsolation.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasInsolation.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasInsolationAvg.label: Meas Insolation Avg
MeasInsolationAvg.description: Computed average insolation, for the period defined on the PeriodAxis over all years of operation since activation date in kWh/square meter. To record the average insolation for Q1 for example this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis. If the period axis is not used this represents the insolation over the entire life of the project from activation date up to the contextual date.
MeasInsolationAvg.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasInsolationAvg.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasInsolationToWeatherAdj.label: Meas Insolation To Weather Adj
MeasInsolationToWeatherAdj.description: Actual measured insolation divided by weather adjusted insolation.
MeasInsolationToWeatherAdj.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasInsolationToWeatherAdj.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasInsolationToWeatherAdjInceptToDate.label: Meas Insolation To Weather Adj Incept To Date
MeasInsolationToWeatherAdjInceptToDate.description: Actual measured insolation divided by weather adjusted insolation inception to date.
MeasInsolationToWeatherAdjInceptToDate.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
MeasInsolationToWeatherAdjInceptToDate.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

MeasScope.label: Meas Scope
MeasScope.description: Scope of the power measurement. Can be "System" for the entire PV system, "Inverter XXX" for a specific inveter, "String YYY" for a specific string.
MeasScope.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

MechComplCertAvailOfFinalDoc.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

MinOutputGuaranteedPct.description: Minimum percent of P50 expected energy production output guaranteed such that if output falls below that level, a refund will be made. For example, if output is guaranteed to be 98% or higher, the minimum threshhold is 98%. If output falls below 98%, a refund will be made.

ModelFactorsParasiticLossFlag.label: Model Factors Parasitic Loss Flag

PowerAC.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

PowerDC.label: Power DC
PowerDC.description: Power (DC) measured at an instant in time
PowerDC.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PowerDC.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

PowerPerfIndex.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PowerPerfIndex.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

PowerRtgInWtEfficForm.label: Power Rtg In Wt Effic Form
PowerRtgInWtEfficForm.description: Indication if the Power Rating (continuous at unity power factor) was provided in the weighted efficiency form. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.
PowerRtgInWtEfficForm.validationRule: Boolean values (TRUE or FALSE) are valid
PowerRtgInWtEfficForm.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

PowerTargetCapMeas.label: Power Target Cap Meas
PowerTargetCapMeas.description: Power expected for capacity measurement when executing IEC 61742-2 for the specified target conditions.
PowerTargetCapMeas.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PowerTargetCapMeas.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

PrecipitationType.label: Precipitation Type
PrecipitationType.description: Type of precipitation according to SYNOP codes
PrecipitationType.precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

PredictedAllInOneYearYield.label: Predicted All In One Year Yield
PredictedAllInOneYearYield.description: Predicted total (all-in) yield for a one year period.
PredictedAllInOneYearYield.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PredictedAllInOneYearYield.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.label: Predicted Energy At The Revenue Meter
PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.description: Predicted active electrical production at the revenue meter for each year, based on historical weather data that is representative for the site, per IEC 61724-3. Calculated as Total Predicted Energy reflecting times of unavailability and parasitic loss. This element is defined as the sum of electrical production over a period of time, for example from the 1st day to the last day of the month, and has a period type of duration. This should not be used with the Period [Axis].
PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPerio.label: Predicted Energy At The Revenue Meter For Period
PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPerio.description: Predicted active electrical production at the revenue meter for each year, based on historical weather data that is representative for the site, per IEC 61724-3. Calculated as Total Predicted Energy reflecting times of unavailability and parasitic loss. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time. If no Period [Axis] is used, the time period for the value is from the date of the value in the instance document to the end of the life of the system.
PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPerio.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPerio.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

PredictedEnergyAvailEstRatio.label: Predicted Energy Avail Est Ratio
PredictedEnergyAvailEstRatio.description: Predicted Energy Availability Estimate by Year, which is the modelled predicted energy for unity availability. The ratio is calculated by dividing PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterInstant by PredictedEnergyAvailable. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time.
PredictedEnergyAvailEstRatio.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PredictedEnergyAvailEstRatio.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

PredictedEnergyAvailable.label: Predicted Energy Available
PredictedEnergyAvailable.description: Predicted energy available is calculated as predicted energy (at unity availability which means that energy is available all the time) multiplied by predicted availability equals predicted energy (at predicted availability). For example, if 10,000 MWh is predicted for unity availability and we predict availability of 0.99, then predicted energy is 9,900 MWh. 10,000=9,900/0.99. This element should be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year.
PredictedEnergyAvailable.validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
PredictedEnergyAvailable.precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

SystemAvailMeasToMeasEnergyPlusLostEnerg.description: Plant energy production or plant energy metered in the time period divided by the sum of that value and the calculated lost energy in the period (kWh). Energy-Based Availability takes into consideration that an hour in a period with high irradiance is more valuable than in a period with low irradiance.

SystemUptimeRatio.label: System Uptime Ratio
